analytic.title: Miaphysite Syriac Patristic Florilegia and Theopaschisim: Abū Rā’iṭah’s Defence of the Christological Trisagion Hymn

biblStruct.note: This paper aims to highlight the original points the West-Syrian and Miaphysite theologian Abū Rāʾitah al-Takrītī (d. 838) uses to defend the addition into the Trisagion hymn: his liturgical arguments, his biblical arguments, and his means of relating Theopaschism to what he maintains to be a proper metaphysical system. The main purpose of the essay, however, is to analyse the patristic quotations Abū Rāʾit˙ah provides to support his position and to demonstrate its orthodoxy. A comparative analysis of these quotations with some Syriac florilegia compiled by Miaphysites between the eighth and ninth centuries demonstrates that Abū Rāʾitah had access to such florilegia and their sources and used them into creating his own florilegium.
